website_summaries.verdict: A simple design and a small frame that's made for the stay-at-home workout warrior.
pros: Work out with confidence thanks to the durable pieces and overall frame construction
Small enough to fit comfortably in a home gym
cons: Not big enough for larger users
Doesn't offer as much as other cages in features and flexibility

website_summaries.verdict: Classic, basic construction for a no frills, high quality rack.
pros: Saber style safety rods included for up to 600 pounds of lifting and a 10-year warranty

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rack
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 1 1/2 years and it has held up to my and my brother's abuse. We mainly do squats, bench, and pull-ups on it. With the addition of some hanging ab straps it is a pretty versatile setup. When we squat, we will go over 400 lbs and this cage has no problems with that weight. If you aren't going to bolt this to your floor, you will need to be careful how hard you re-rack your bar since it tends to lean forward when finishing squats. The cage came with some touch up paint, but we didn't bother using it. The original gray will wear off, but that is just normal wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviewers have said
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack to replace a traditional bench press and squat rack that I used for years. I work out alone so this facilitates that practice. I've used it for 5 workout sessions so far with a variety of benches and I'm impressed. Like other reviewers have said, the hole spacing is too much, it doesn't accommodate for the depth of each person's chest (too much play). As many folks have stated, the paint flakes off immediately, both on the frame and the bars. It'll do fine without contact, but otherwise, better get used to it. it doesn't bother me, however -- nature of the beast.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: great for the price and for the home gym
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat it. Works really well especially if you have limited space. I have put over 400lbs and its very sturdy and holds well. If you are a powerlifter or strongman throwing 500 plus pounds around daily then this is not for you. For the home gym its perfect. Building it took ~1hour which was a little longer but I was going slowly making sure I do It right the first time. Directions was not the greatest but if you look at the pictures and part numbers its fine. One thing is that I used a battery impact gun and it bent the farm from over tightening slightly.
customer_reviews.author: kH

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: A very solid power rack. I have it in my basement, it clears the ceiling joists by just a few inches. I use for squatting and bench pressing. Some of the paint has scratched off, as would be expected, but it came with replacement paint. I don't care enough to touch it up. In this case, it's function over form.
customer_reviews.author: Review349085

customer_reviews.title: You can pretty much construct this rack by yourself
customer_reviews.text: You can pretty much construct this rack by yourself. It helps to have someone hold each corner up, but once you get all the bolts finger tight on the base you can put the rest of it together by yourself. I did not use the instructions as it was really that easy. All you need are two 19MM wrenches. I used a regular 1/2" drive with a ratcheting wrench. That is all you need to construct this beast. All pieces of this rack feel durable and you are provided with a small bottle of touch up paint if you need it. Good luck with your gains and be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Bran

customer_reviews.title: Great Squat Rack for Most of Us Who are Not Heavy Weight Lifters
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically to train up quadriceps and hamstrings for alpine skiing during the off season. Allows me to safely squat with weight on shoulders due to the adjustable side structures which arrest the weight in the event of a stumble. Also, steel pegs allow weight to be stored at or above shoulder level until needed. Structure is easy to assemble in about 30 minutes. Rack can handle several hundred pounds. For the price, this is a good quality rack for most of us. The really heavy squatters may need something with greater capacity.
customer_reviews.author: M. Finnell

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack for the Price, However...
customer_reviews.text: Trying to upload a pic of the knurled pull-up bar. It is uncomfortable, and leaves knurled impressions on your palm. Suggest the manufacturer leave this pull-up bar smooth, as well as the lift offs and safety bars unpainted (as other reviewers suggested). The paint chipping is really unattractive, and makes a mess of your floor. Also, the Lat Pull Down attachment has friction due to its design, on both the to and fro action. :( Not a total detractor from using it, but if you like smooth working attachments, this would not be for you. I find it annoying every time, but manage to work with it nonetheless. Other than these issues, it has been a fine safety/power rack!:)
customer_reviews.author: M Castaneda, DC, CPN

customer_reviews.title: Great rack at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great rack for the price. We have been using for six months at the time of this review with no complaints. To date we have only tested it up to a little over 250 pound squats but it hasn't shown any issues and has performed well. We have had several failed reps with no issues. Far worth the money to not have free weights dropped on someone if they fail their reps.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice power rack
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking sturdy rack, went together easily and works great. Only rate for 600# but that's more then I will ever have on it anyway. Would have been nice if it came with another set of catches but they are sold separately so all's good.
customer_reviews.author: jim bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great safety net
customer_reviews.text: Great product. For lone trainers, this is a necessary piece of equipment. This particular rack is easy to assemble and has a solid construction. It works perfectly for chest (inclined, flat, and declined), squats, shoulder press... and you can even do pull-ups with it. During training, it really helps to know that if you miss that last rep you will not be squashed... in that way you can push your limits safely. Only two negative observations, that really do not detract much from the product: Instructions are not incredibly clear in the choice of screw size at each step of assembly, and the rack could ship with more washers (you can only one per screw, but two would be better).
customer_reviews.author: Milano Americano

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. Stable
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Stable, well made, pretty easy to put together by myself. The safety bars for dropped squats are great. I added some foam to cut down on noise. I have it on concrete in a garage and have not bolted it to the concrete slab. It seems just fine with 3 plates on a side for squats - stable and safe. The pull-up/chin-up bar across the front is very nice too with good grip texture.
customer_reviews.author: Tourgen Roust

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: We've had this rack for two years and we're still very happy with it. We've used it a lot, we've been less than caring with it and it's still going strong. It's decently stable for its weight and it definitely does what we need it to do. The drawbacks? The paint fell off rapidly around the pins after some unkind racking. The knuckling on the pull up bar is brutal (expect your hands to fall off if you don't use gloves). That's it. Considering that this is only a couple of hundred bucks, this is really great value. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kat/Seb

customer_reviews.title: One of the best budget power racks
customer_reviews.text: I have used this power rack for over a solid year so I'd like to throw in my review. Cheap, sturdy, and does the job is the best way to describe this. This thing inspires quite the confidence you'll need to safely bench or squat. (I have dropped 300 lbs on it and it has never failed to save me from any failed squat attempt). The pulley attachment gives you quite a few nice options, and there's several nice little pieces you can buy to store your weights (this also gives it some weight to keep it down). If any negatives, the paint chips and I don't even know why they bothered to paint it.
customer_reviews.author: kyo

customer_reviews.title: Great rack. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Easy to use. Assembly could have been slightly clearer but took about an hour once I figured out what they were saying. Some of the different sized bars were a little close in length so they were difficult to tell apart. Suggestion-Wrap the different sized bars separately or put tiny labels on them. Would have saved about 20 minutes. now that it is assembled though i love it and it works well. Very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: ABC123

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a more narrow cage (this one is 43" wide) and had looked at the Rogue R3, but that one was a lot more expensive and also needed to be bolted down to the floor. This one has a small footprint and is still quite sturdy. Nice pullup bar with light knurling. The only place the paint came off on ours was on the slider safety bars. The instructions for assembly were quite good, surprisingly. Not hard to put together at all. We are looking at adding the DR100 dip attachment, as well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: kalysonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great power rack for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack for squatting and benching safely. Even if you squat over 400, I'm sure this rack could handle it. I've bailed on 365 squat multiple times and the safety bars took it like it was nothing. The only gripe I have is I wish it was taller. I bought extra j hooks which makes it super easy to reset them in a different position on the rack. Also I bought dip bar attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I've had this rack for like 4 years now and use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this rack for like 4 years now and use it all the time, even taken it apart and moved it a couple times. Still as sturdy as ever. My husband is too big to use it for pull-ups but it's the perfect size for me, I'm even short enough to overhead press inside it! Great investment, I love having a gym at home.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Solid power rack for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The PowerLine PPR200X Power Rack is a very good rack, especially considering the cost. I had a Powertec Power Rack at one point and it was a little more stable and a higher quality, but it was also double the money. The PowerLine rack came in three, well-packaged boxes and I was able to put this rack together by myself - it would have been much easier and quicker if I had a helper - but very manageable alone. All in all, I would recommend this power rack; however, if you're planning on lifting a lot of weight (400+ pounds) you may want a stronger rack.
customer_reviews.author: A. Polselli

customer_reviews.title: Worth.Every.Penny.
customer_reviews.text: Surely there are better (spoken more expensive) power racks out there but this one is *awesome* for the price. Works perfect for me with my Bowflex 5.1 bench. Pros: -Inexpensive -Sturdy -Easy to assemble (took me about 45 minutes by myself) Cons: -The cage itself seems to have pretty good powder coat on it however (as you will read in other reviews), the sabers and the "hooks" have paint that starts flaking/chipping almost immediately. Thinking I may have them sand blasted and powder coated or just sand all of the paint off of them and leave them bare metal. Not a big deal for me as it is in my garage. Bottom Line: Excellent product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Laphroaig

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack has stood the test of time (3years). I bought it bc my gym had one squat rack and people curled and shrugged in it. I've went down (semi-controlled) with 405 and it held up. It was the same price as used ones online and with the attachments you have pretty much everything you need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Sturdy. East to put together
customer_reviews.text: Solid and Sturdy. East to put together. Even by myself, took about 45 minutes. Haven't used it enough to leave a thorough review. Update: about 8 months in. Still really solid, paint chips off, but I knew that coming in. I bought a cable crossover machine and now feel like I have a complete gym. Still have to buy a few other things, but it starts with the rack. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: You need this for your home gym
customer_reviews.text: This is a a great product and I have used it a lot. This is essential for safe solo lifting. The only thing I didnt like about it was that the lat pulldown attachment (sold separately) could have been designed to not stick out the back so far the back. It would have been nice if it could all be incorporated within the back frame, maybe. That attachment adds about 2 feet or wasted space to the back. Doesnt fit well in small rooms with the attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Gollum

customer_reviews.title: great rack. It's sturdy and feels very safe
customer_reviews.text: My grandmother, (who doesn't understand these things) excitedly asked, "does it come with the shirtless guy, to assemble it?" No, it does not. Lol. In all seriousness, great rack. It's sturdy and feels very safe. And it's at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: At heavier weights there is some rocking when you rack ...
customer_reviews.text: At heavier weights there is some rocking when you rack the weights, which is a little worrying. Almost fell over once when I was doing pull-ups also. It's a solid rack for lighter weight, but if you're squatting 300+ you'll probably want a sturdier rack.
customer_reviews.author: stuart millner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and very solid
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and very solid. I will add the lat bar attachment in the near future. Probably and extra set of pins too so I don't have to move them between squat and bench position. Would be nice if it came with an extra set, but no big deal. Really happy with the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Shy

customer_reviews.title: Squat rack
customer_reviews.text: I just put together my powerline squat rack. It took me an hour by myself, then my husband tightened all the bolts at the end using a 19mm socket. I'm excited to start using this rack. Another reviewer said to separate all the pieces & label them & that was excellent advice as the bolts were almost the same size. It's very sturdy & the instructions were easy to follow. I'd recommend this squat rack.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: Just saw that I bought this rack in 2012 and can't believe the quality for the price. The rack is still going strong after 7 years of abuse. I've taken it apart and put it together no less than 5 times and the only thing I've had to replace on it is the wire for the lat pulldown attachment. It's nothing fancy but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: tbetschart

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack
customer_reviews.text: Easily assembled, total rack weight - approx 135lbs. Has already received plenty of abuse without any problems. I used black electrical tape to mark my most commonly used holes and the center point of the pullup bar. I am very pleased with the product. Delivery - Shipping carrier stated when they arrived that they couldn't complete the delivery due to the steps accessing my property [15 steps in total] - I ended up carrying the product from the truck to my house. Comes in 3 boxes - 40lbs to 50lbs each.
customer_reviews.author: IrishDad

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Uber fast shipping and peace of mind for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this purchase. My husband hurt himself when lifting alone. This was a mandatory purchase if he wanted to continue doing that. I feel so much better now that he uses this and the quality of the product is so great. Shipping was also super fast! I couldn't be happier and more at peace.
customer_reviews.author: Quiet_Storm

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the great price fool you
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the great price fool you, this is a solid power rack. The base is just wide enough to not feel constrained (I'm 6 feet tall)...the only thing that will give you early pause is the depth (front to back) which feels a little tight, but is more than enough room for Squats and if it isn't, you're walking your weight out way too far. This Rack is Stable! I have yet to feel it couldn't handle any weight that I was using. You would have to spend twice this amount to get any type of upgrade and unless you own a gym and want a rack for all day use, this is more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: A bit small
customer_reviews.text: Not great for larger lifters who have little flexibility due to its smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Davis

customer_reviews.title: great economy rack
customer_reviews.text: I run a back yard crossfit box and have about 7-8 folks that frequent my place for workouts. When we use this rack we use it hard! Im very happy with it and would suggest it up to about 300 lbs. Most of us are crossfitters and not power lifters so we will never need more weight catch than that. Assembly was straightforward and quick. I would recommend to anyone assembling a backyard/garage gym
customer_reviews.author: BH1981

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing piece of equipment. Very sturdy and solid contruction. Easy as hell to assemble. It does get strached very easily, and the touch-up paint they gave me didn't even match. But no biggie. It could be pink for all I care, gets the job done and is awesome. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy product for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy product for a home gym. It was good value for money and is sturdy for most people. The assembly process was a bit tedious but the instructions were clear and the end result was good. I wish they had not painted this thing as the paint is continually flaking off with contact.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for three weeks no as a squat rack and bench press. To short for me to do overhead press, which just means I have to pull the bar out. Very sturdy, some paint chipping from my bar knurls, but to be expected. Very satisfied. Bry
customer_reviews.author: Bry

customer_reviews.title: It's good, but the paint gets peeled off as you ...
customer_reviews.text: It's good, but the paint gets peeled off as you slide it in and out of the holes because of the burr on the holes. I prefer  instead, because it has quick lock on the bars (twist to lock), numbers on the holes, and less burr. But good product
customer_reviews.author: Soc entrep

customer_reviews.title: small package, lots of power.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic squatrack, supports up to 600 or so lbs, I had to ask the manufacturer directly. Plenty of room and just short enough to fit in my apartment. its compact but wide enough for olympic bars, would be nice if it came with a second set of pins.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This rack works great. It seems to be holding up well. I really like the safety catches. Now you can work out solo and still be safe. I have had about 250 pounds on it and I have had no problems. I think it is rated for 400-500 pounds so for us mortals I think this rack will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: ... this rack some time ago and it's holding up great in the garage after constant use by the family
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack some time ago and it's holding up great in the garage after constant use by the family. I'm not a 300 lb bench presser so not sure how it handles under that type of weight, but for the average person I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Prentice

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: update: I had this for almost a year and it has stood up to all my abuse of heavy lifting. My only complaint is the frame is a little lighter than I want. overall its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Rack
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. He just retired from a place where he had access to weight lifting equipment, and he didn't want to join a gym. He enjoys working out at home and he is very pleased with this. Very well built, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: s. clement

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, missing one small part
customer_reviews.text: Unit was adequately packaged and arrives in three boxes. Assembly was simple even with one person. It seems sturdy enough for my use. The bag of bolts, nuts and washers that came with my unit was missing one washer, but this could be easily remedied by visiting a local hardware store, albeit inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Ben T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rack for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't think you can beat this rack. I lift in my basement which has pretty low ceilings. The rack fits perfectly. It feels very sturdy and can be upgraded with a lat/row tower (which I also reviewed). My only complaint is the same as the others: the painted liftoffs and support rails. Otherwise this one of the best purchases I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hayward

customer_reviews.title: I love this rack
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. It's cheap but it's held up and has saved me a few times. It does feel a bit wobbly when doing pullups, but it's stable enough. Just don't get crazy and think you can kip on this thing!
customer_reviews.author: JOEL GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I needed
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for a small rack that would fit in my house and looked at this one for a long time. I decided to pick this up along with the cable system and can't even say how much I love it. I actually freed up room, but getting rid of a large bench and squat rack, and can do more, more safely. It's an entry level rack, but I expect it's more than I'll need for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: DEF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Highly functional and had no problem putting it together. Highly recommend this product and the product got to me on time and in good condition. I've had it about 5 months now and still no issues. I did buy the lat pulldown add on but I haven't attached it as yet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Shipped fast in three packages. Was able to put ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast in three packages. Was able to put together by myself with just a pliers and ratchet set.
customer_reviews.author: M.Sumo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well made. No problems with it. I've had to tear it down and rebuild it through a few different moves. Very easy to disassemble and reassemble.
customer_reviews.author: Geofferson

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and seems well built
customer_reviews.text: Had no problems putting it together. Very sturdy and seems well built. After cracking a rib I decided I needed a power cage and I'm very pleased with my purchase. I can push myself to complete failure with no fears now. Also allowed me to get rid of my pull up bar. A side benefit is I have somewhere to attach my bands to.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Wiborg

customer_reviews.title: Powerline PPR200X POWER RACK,  5 STARS all the way
customer_reviews.text: Powerline PPR200X POWER RACK, 5 STARS all the way , you can do all sorts of different exercises that can help you on your snatch and clean & jerk , without the walk in power rack you will hinder yourself for competition, with the safety bars you are not afraid to handle the weight you want to handle if you should work out by yourself, this was bought to strengthen parts of the body which can never be done with just a squat rack, I already had 500 lbs on the rack which was very sturdy, back training after 35 year lay-off and ready to compete. Ray Blaha
customer_reviews.author: Julia Blaha

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great product
customer_reviews.text: This squat rack was very easy to assemble. It's extremely sturdy and can do everything I need it to. It's perfect for Squats, Shoulder Press and Chin-ups. It can also be used for Bench Press if needed. Minimum tools required for assembly. I put this product on carpet, so between the carpet and the rubber stoppers along the bottom, this rack doesn't move. It can handle plenty of weight. The only con I could give it is that the paint chips off pretty easy, but that's to be expected. I don't need this thing to look pretty, I need it to handle the weight, which it does. Great product, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: mrkid85

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Sturdy (i have mine on a mat). I can see where this model is more for a beginner to moderate lifter. So since that's where I'm at now, works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: melvin alvarez

customer_reviews.title: My son uses it all the time and this prevents ...
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it all the time and this prevents me from being forced to spot him when weightlifting. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner/intermediate level power rack. If you weigh under 200 pounds this should work for you! It moves around a little when I do pull ups, but I can't complain since it's so much cheaper than other power racks. Plus free shipping on amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Sea of Green

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This power rack has been great. It was easy to assemble and very sturdy. The paint chips off the pegs but that was expected. The only problem I have with this is the knurling on the pull up bar. I wish it was smooth.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Power Rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to allow me to train at home without worry about being crushed while doing squats and bench presses without a spotter. It was easy to assemble and it has proven to be very sturdy. I have found that with this rack, a flat utility bench and a 300 pound olympic weight set, I can train every part of my body intensely without a fear of being pinned from pushing for that one last rep. I recommend it highly for the price I paid. PS; The built-in chinning bar is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Book_Guy

customer_reviews.title: powerline makes a great product...
customer_reviews.text: We have a gym here at work and have been wanting to update equipment. So we purchased this item. It doesn't disappoint. great finish, very sturdy, best price for product on all racks on AMAZON. By the way I used saver shipping and still received it in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Black

customer_reviews.title: decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: this power rack was priced really well in comparison to others and it does the job, but i wish the base was a little heavier or something to be a little more sturdy. You can do bench press and squats etc with it no problem but I don't think it would hold up to a lot of heavy abuse or any cross-fit type workouts. It also has a built in pull-up bar on the top front. A pretty good aspect of the rack is that it is a space saver and fits in well where you need it because it is not bulky and there's not a lot of parts sticking out. Great for a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: quick shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast! I had everything all set up and ready the same day. It is very sturdy and will not budge.
customer_reviews.author: Long Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the home gym my son has built
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the home gym my son has built. His buddies are also enjoying it. The rack makes a huge difference in his workout. Product arrived quickly and easy to assemble. Great vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: its good enough for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: nothing wrong with this setup at all. i use it to squat, press, bench, curl, rack pulls, pullups, etc in. keep your fingers clear of the machined holes during setup though as I learned the hard way they are fapping sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for heavy lifting
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. I struggled over which one to buy or to make my own. This has served me well for almost two years. It is sturdy and safe. I am 59 and can safely do 360 lb. squats in it with confidence. I loaded the bar with 390 lbs. and gave it a shot. I slowly went down until I hit the safety bars. I climbed from under the bar, disassembled the weights and started over with the normal amount of weight. Disappointed that I had to climb out, but a man's ego needs a humble experience to keep us in check.
customer_reviews.author: CoachDave

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as I thought..Steel bends
customer_reviews.text: The steel bends during assembly if you start tightening down the bolts by hand. This is me just using two wrenches. It's a little unnerving . If this thing will bend during assembly, will it save my life during a squat? I would not buy again. I wish I looked around more. Maybe at $300 it's a good deal but the price has risen significantly. Paid $377 before taxes in Febuary 2014.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Well built and sturdy. Everything you'd expect from the description. Pull up bar can can get a little slippery if you're prone to sweaty hands but a little chalk or tape fixes that.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece of equipment! Putting it together was a little easier than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: James Acquaviva

customer_reviews.title: Good budget rack.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Knurling on the pullup bar is a little harsh but that didn't take much to remedy. Would purchase again if I ever needed another rack for something.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Compton

customer_reviews.title: A Must Buy For Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: It's everything that I need it to be. Knurled bar scrapes the finish off the rests but I guess that should be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S

customer_reviews.title: Great for squats and various presses
customer_reviews.text: Very solid piece. Took an hour or 2 to put together myself. Great for squats and various presses. Pull up bar is sturdy and has grooves on each side for better grip
customer_reviews.author: Ofir A.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Simple build, and Strong.
customer_reviews.text: Felt bad for the delivery guys because the box is so heavy, but could not be happier with the rack. I use 300 lbs on it regularly and have had no problems with it. Im like 230 ish and can do pull ups on it with no shaking or fear of the thing falling apart. It the perfect instant gym for my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice power rack
customer_reviews.text: Really nice power rack, I bought it so I could later attach the latch attachment. I was about to purchaser the atlas power rack since it could hold more weight but i did not due to it not having a lat attachment.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack 😜
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Just order it, you'll be happy with it. Can train heavy without worry of injury. That's enough reason.
customer_reviews.author: Mane

customer_reviews.title: We've been using this rack for 2+ years now and ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this rack for 2+ years now and it's still holding up. We've ditched over 350+ pounds on the safety bars and it still stands.
customer_reviews.author: Francis L Alfonso

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy. Assembly was a little tough as some holes didn't line up so my first workout was trying to heave on the pieces to line them up. Also with the bushings on the bottom it ends up being an inch taller than advertised so it didn't fit in my basement.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner Power Rack
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't take up too much space and the number of exercises you can perform is countless!! Add an olympic bar, some weights, a TRX or Gymnastic rings and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: mnzrsddq9

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier with this rack
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with this rack. I have no idea why I waited so long. It is the perfect height and size. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zuiker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty easy to build, I did it alone in about 30 or 45 minutes. It supports all the weight I need it to support and serves as a bench rack as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dadityourself

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack is great for squatting, bench press, shrugs etc. The most weight that I've put on it is 305 pounds, but its sturdy enough so far. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Day

customer_reviews.title: Best rack for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great power rack, perfect for a home gym on the cheap without huge loss in quality. A little wobbly when over 250lbs slamming onto the rack but it's still great. A little narrower than I'm used to but not a complaint really, just an observation.
customer_reviews.author: JohnInFlorida

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: At 6'7" my only complaint is that it's a bit short and a bit narrow. The pull-up bar is just a bit taller than I am. The rack however is stable and sturdy. I can easily hang off it and it barely moves. I did need a pair of 19mm wrenches to put it together but that was it. It took about an hour to assemble and the instructions weren't great but the rack is very simple. For the more normal sized people of the world it's very adequate for beginners and intermediate lifters.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: kinda small, but great equipment.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for me and my husband (technically he did cuz it's his moola) so we can break free from 24hour fitness. rack is great, was easy to assemble, and very sturdy. downside is that my husband is a little tall (71" tall) and we had to raise the rack with bricks so we can both do pull-ups. besides that, workouts are great, gas is saved, and gym memberships are cancelled! no more waiting for some douche to finish curling in a squat rack.
customer_reviews.author: La Oister

customer_reviews.title: Strong and polished
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, bought it for my husband for Christmas. The only complaint I have is that the paint chips where the bar rests due to the weight that rests on it. It's made well, very sturdy, and has a nice finish to it. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Joy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bar scrapes off the hook's paint. Somewhat shaky when loading up the bar but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: fireware90

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty impressed with it so far
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty impressed with it so far. I have been mostly using the pull up bar due to a running injury that prevents me from doing squats right now. Its sturdy, the directions were simple enough, and it doesnt take up to much space.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: love this rack!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rack 4 years ago and I love it! This is an excellent home power rack.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: outstanding quality, my son is a body builder and uses this equipment daily. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great budget power rack and perfect for beginners. Does require routine maintenance after a few workouts but depends on how much weight you start banging around. Assembly did not take to long but I'm used to bad instructions. The paint sucks and I will need to touch it up to prevent any rust.
customer_reviews.author: Chez75

customer_reviews.title: This has replaced most of my other equipment saving me ...
customer_reviews.text: This has replaced most of my other equipment saving me a lot of space. It also feel solid and reliable which is important for safety and peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Roberts

customer_reviews.title: 5 star power rack
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing not to like about it, it is what it says it is. The five stars fits it.
customer_reviews.author: B&C Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Rack Attack
customer_reviews.text: The PowerLine PPR200X Power Rack was delivered in 3 well-packaged boxes. The instructions were clear and assembly was a snap. The rack is very sturdy and I'm sure will make an excellent coat rack when New Year's resolutions fall by the wayside.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Riley

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Paint peels but not an issue for ...
customer_reviews.text: Had for two years. Love it. Paint peels but not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: tommy d

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Had for a month now. Wonderful. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build, great to use
customer_reviews.text: It didn't really take me long to set this up and begin using it and it's pretty damn solid as far as I can tell. Shipped incredibly fast as well, almost 4 days ahead of the estimated delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The cage came in three well pack boxes. It was very easy to put together took about an hour or less. It is an awesome addition to my gym. No more spotters needed for many excerises. I am very satisfied with it and would recommend it as a must for any gym.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ivan Sr.

customer_reviews.title: very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this power rack. I only have minor complaints. The two small bar racks should not be painted as the bar scrapes it off immediately. Two parts were damaged on arrival but replacements were sent quickly. Over all it works great for my simple needs.
customer_reviews.author: glcs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginners power rack
customer_reviews.text: You really can't beat this price for what you get. Perfect beginners power rack. After fully assembled, everything feels sturdy and of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Hoffert

customer_reviews.title: Regarding 7" Barbell
customer_reviews.text: I had just wanted to share info regarding a couple previous reviews mentioning the need for 7" barbell. It is not for sure necessary. It depends on your barbell's width between the "hook" settings. I am using a 6" one and it fits well. I had mistakenly listened to other reviews and ordered a new 7" one before I tested my 6" one. I regret it and wasted $60. Hope this may help. Test your bar first.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: This rack has been perfect for me doing the SS workouts
customer_reviews.text: This rack has been perfect for me doing the SS workouts. I've been able to do all the exercises I need with this and a bench. Easy setup from the instructions and nothing was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: powerrack satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Needed a powerack...sorry, WANTED a powerack did some searching everywhere and I mean everywhere...Amazon.com and I never shopped here before, they delivered a great price for my perfect product. Nothing negative about it and it is exactly what I wanted, easy to assemble with two people. But I could see a challenge building it yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Paul H. Buddemeyer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Decent price, solid, easy to put together. Not fond of the 'hooks' for benching. Get the J hooks.
customer_reviews.author: RonW

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack for the price
customer_reviews.text: this is a great power rack not as wide as others but will definitely get the job done. It was easy to construct one man job. Ive used it for a few solid weeks now and I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Schultz

product_meta.title: Body-Solid Powerline PPR200X Adjustable Power Rack for Weightlifting and Strength Training
product_meta.description:
Enjoy the same comprehensive weightlifting experience at home as in the gym with the Powerline by Body-Solid Power Rack (PPR200X). This weight cage is designed to help weightlifters fire up their workout safely and effectively, with two heat-tempered lift-offs, two saber-style safety rods for solo lifting, and a 41-inch-wide knurled chin-up bar integrated into the top of the rack. The wide walk-in design has a full 24 inches between each upright pillar, offering plenty of side-to-side movement for a wide variety of exercises. Use this workout cage for squats, incline presses, flat bench, shoulder shrugs, and more. Choose from 18 adjustment levels, and customize your power rack with other Powerline components like the Lat Attachment (PLA200X) and Bench (PFID130X). All barbells, weights, and collars are optional and sold separately. When assembled, the Powerline Power Rack measures 44 by 46 by 82 inches (L x W x H) and weighs 133 pounds. It is backed by the Powerline 10-Year In-Home , which covers the frame for 10 years and all other parts for one year.

AMAZON.COM
Fire up your workouts with the PowerLine power rack, which helps weightlifters work out safely and efficiently while performing squats, military presses, and more. The power rack boasts a wide walk-in design that offers plenty of side-to-side movement for a variety of exercises, along with two heat-tempered liftoffs and two saber-style safety rods that hold up to heavy use through the years. In addition, the rack offers a total of 18 positions, helping it accommodate a ton of different heights and exercises. Whether your workout regimen includes squats, incline presses, flat bench presses, shoulder shrugs, or calf raises, the power rack makes your routine easy and safe. The rack measures 44 by 82 by 46 inches (W x H x D), weighs 136 pounds, and carries a 10-year warranty on the frame and one-year warranty on all other parts. All barbells, weights, and collars are sold separately.
feature_bullets: QUALITY CONSTRUCTION: Power racks help weightlifters work out safely and effectively at home
SAFETY: The Body-Solid Powerline Power Rack has a wide walk-in design with 24 inches between upright pillars for easy motion during training
CAPACITY: Rack weighs 133lbs, and has 2 heat-tempered lift-offs, and 2 saber-style safety rods .
DIMENSIONS: The Body-Solid Powerline Power Rack measures 44 by 46 by 82 inches (L x W x H) with 18 adjustment levels
SECURITY: Body-Solid's Power Racks and gear sets the standard in home gym equipment
